intro: Astrantia croatica, commonly known as the Croatian aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, arranged in a spherical or flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Astrantia croatica is often found in moist meadows and woodlands, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
